WorkItem.Description:
When you are underhit cap for spriest, changing a gem to make you hit capped does not seem to effect the score of the items in the right pane.
Â 
Example in point, see attached screenshot, the main items I am talking about are the Circle of Ossus and the Belt of Omission. 
The main differences between these items are 64hit and 80 crit on the belt, with 80 haste and 64spr on the circle. Using the rel stats value for each one, it would put the circle at 183.84 vs 107.04 for the belt. From the screenshot the belt is rated higher than the circle when the math proves otherwise.

Comments.Message: You are operating under the assumption that RSV's are used as the stat weights to value the items, which is COMPLETELY WRONG.
But prove to me otherwise that the hit belt is better than the other one, it really isn't.

...what? Ferret, Rawr is here accurately model combat. Ferret, A) Read up on how Rawr makes comparisons. Sounds like you're misunderstanding, and it's doing it accurately. B) Compare what your stats would be with each of them equipped.
Looking at your stats in the image, without the hit belt you are dropping well below hit cap, which means that without the belt you will see the RSV's for Hit jump WAY up.

I am gaining more spr and more haste which is better than 80 crit and hit which i dont need, since I am capped. So its basically 80haste+64spr vs 80crit. From what I've read and seen all over the place, haste is better than crit. So you see what I mean now about this?
The belt I have now does not have hit on it.

Try, one more time. The values shown in the comparison screen, quite literally, is equal to the total value of your character, with that item equipped, minus the total value of your character, with that slot empty. Try equipping them. See your DPS with each equipped. Note which is higher.

89dps ug with belt, 66 hit over cap 
55dps ug for circle, 2 hit over cap
Judging by your hit %, I'm guessing you're just mistaken about being hit capped then. TNSe, can you confirm?

I have the 6 points in talents which gives me 6% more, so I am getting 11.09% from hit rating, 6% from talents, for a total of 17%. Even when I hover over hit rating, it says I have 100.09% hit rating for shadow.

I have the 6 points in talents which gives me 6% more, so I am getting 11.09% from hit rating, 6% from talents, for a total of 17%. Even when I hover over hit rating, it says I have 100.09% hit rating for shadow.
